quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Never worry about theory as long as the machinery does what it's supposed to do.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Never listen to newscasts. Saves wear and tear on the nervous system.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Every law that was ever written opened up a new way to graft.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: I found out a long time ago that you have to take some chances in this life. Otherwise you are just a vegetable, headed for the soup pot.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Take sides! Always take sides! You will sometimes be wrong — but the man who refuses to take sides must always be wrong.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: If you would know a man, observe how he treats a cat.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: I counted to ten slowly, using binary notation.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: 'Die trying' is the proudest human thing

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: When a fact came along, he junked theories that failed to match.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: The best things in history are accomplished by people who get tired of being shoved around.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: A rational anarchist believes that concepts, such as 'state' and 'society' and 'government' have no existence save as physically exemplified in the acts of self-responsible individuals.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: I will accept the rules that you feel necessary to your freedom. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: There is no worse tyranny than to force a man to pay for what he does not want merely because you think it would be good for him.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Boats and ships are female because they are beautiful, lovable, expensive and unpredictable.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Progress doesn't come from early risers — progress is made by lazy men looking for easier ways to do things.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: A generation which ignores history has no past and no future.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Do not handicap your children by making their lives easy.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: If you happen to be one of the fretful minority who can do creative work, never force an idea; you'll abort it if you do. Be patient and you'll give birth to it when the time is ripe. Learn to wait.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: You can have peace. Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: You live and learn. Or you don't live long.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: Be wary of strong drink. It can make you shoot at tax collectors — and miss.

quotation.name: Robert A. Heinlein
quotation.text: A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, comfort the dying, take orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently and die gallantly. Specialization is for insects.

quotation.name: Wernher von Braun
quotation.text: Don't tell me that man doesn't belong out there. Man belongs wherever he wants to go and he'll do plenty well when he gets there.

quotation.name: Wernher von Braun
quotation.text: We can lick gravity, but sometimes the paperwork is overwhelming.

quotation.name: Wernher von Braun
quotation.text: My experiences with science led me to God. They challenge science to prove the existence of God. But must we really light a candle to see the sun?

quotation.name: Wernher von Braun
quotation.text: It is in scientific honesty that I endorse the presentation of alternative theories for the origin of the universe, life and man in the science classroom. It would be an error to overlook the possibility that the universe was planned rather than happening by chance.

quotation.name: Wernher von Braun
quotation.text: Basic research is what I am doing when I don't know what I am doing.

quotation.name: Robert Louis Steenson
quotation.text: The Dog, and the Plough, and the Hunter, and all. And the star of the sailor, and Mars, These shone in the sky, and the pail by the wall. Would be half full of water and stars.

quotation.name: Mike Fincke, NASA Astronaut
quotation.text: We have some special space shampoo that doesn't require water, and it does a pretty good job. So at without a bath, we're still pretty good, and we don't smell too bad.

quotation.name: Valery Ryumin
quotation.text: All the conditions necessary for murder are met if you shut 2 men in a cabin measuring 18'x20' and leave them together for 2 months.
